Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
```sh
HashMultiplier="6"    #1 for sol/s, 3 for ksol/s, 6 for Msol/s
NetworkHashRate="98.71" #in Msol/s
MyHashRate="1"
if $AmIalreadyHashing; then
    blocksPerDay="$(echo "scale=8; (24*(1/((60/(($MyHashRate*(1^$HashMultiplier))/($NetworkHashRate*(1^$HashMultiplier))))/3600)))" | bc)"
else
    blocksPerDay="$(echo "scale=8; (24*(1/((60/(($MyHashRate*(1^$HashMultiplier))/(($NetworkHashRate+$MyHashRate)*(1^$HashMultiplier))))/3600)))" | bc)"
fi```

Author: –ë–û–ú–ë –û–ù#6902
Content: @jl777c i was playing around with this basic algebra stuff but i still think that i cannot apply my CN formula for the same calculation in KMD (or any other equihash i suppose)... this is not extremely important tbh, i'm just trying to clarify things to myself, but allow me to explain... in CN coins, daemon never reports "network hash rate" in any response whatsoever... if one wants to calculate network hash rate, it's a simple division of difficulty by block time (e.g. current Monero diff is 36.5b, block time is 120sec, therefore net hash rate is ~300MH/s). so to calculate profit based on hash rate, it's simple as `(hr/diff)*reward`...

Author: –ë–û–ú–ë –û–ù#6902
Content: however, the relation between difficulty and net hash rate for KMD simply doesn't add up in any way :/

Author: –ë–û–ú–ë –û–ù#6902
Content: for example... current KMD diff is `212764720`, block time is `62`... that should give us that net hash rate is `3431689` Sol/s i suppose

Author: –ë–û–ú–ë –û–ù#6902
Content: or `3.4MSol/s`.... but that's not the case... it looks like current net hash rate is `56` MSol/s

Author: –ë–û–ú–ë –û–ù#6902
Content: and that's a huge difference there...

Author: –ë–û–ú–ë –û–ù#6902
Content: i know i am averaging some things here, but even with that the difference is way to big to be affected by my averaging...
